name: BEST WESTERN Premier L'Horset Opera

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Hotel start of March 2007, as soon as we arrived we were delighted with the location, 5 minutes from Opera House and about the same to The Louvre. The Staff were excellent and nothing we required was too much trouble for them, they made us very welcome. The rooms were very clean and beds very comfortable. The light breakfast in the breakfast room is a lovely way to start the day but do look out for the cooked egg options at about 4 Euro extra as we missed the little sign on the buffet table. This Hotel is a little Oasis in the midst of bustling Paris and we would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Central Yet Quiet Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also highly recommend the welcoming Brazilia Bar just around the corner for lunch/light snack. The soup with cheese and croutons is the best I have tasted in a long time.
reviews.title: LOVED this hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved this hotel and can't wait to stay here again. It's only a five-minute walk from the Royal Opera with tons of shops, restaurants, bakeries, bars, and ATMs in the area. It's about a 10-minute walk from the Louvre, les Galleries Lafayette (shopping), and many other popular sights.
reviews.title: A Great Choice

likes.liked: — Friendly staff and great value for money

reviews.text: The rooms were large by European standards and very tastefully decorated in French country. We requested a double bed since it was our anniversary, so I don't know if most of their double rooms have twin beds like a lot of European hotels or not. We had a beautiful veranda that overlooked the street. The bathroom was smallish but had full tub and shower. Not much of a hair dryer, so bring your own. The room was quiet even though it faced the street (it was a quiet side street).
reviews.title: very good hotel

likes.disliked: — bathrooms could be bigger but are fine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk was supremely helpful in getting us acclimated to the area on a map and suggesting area restaurants. The continental breakfast buffet was included in the hotel price and was quite nice. Numerous world newspapers and magazines were complimentary in the lobby. There was also a nice, quiet bar in the lobby. The staff at the front desk and bar spoke good English, but most of the other hotel staff did not.
reviews.title: Loved the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel from Aug 23-27. We checked in at 11:00 pm and after a long day, we were told that our rate would be 23$ more since we had a baby with us. We told them that the policy as stated on bestwestern.com was that a child under 12 was free. But they refused to budge. The next day, we spoke to the manager who told us, it was not for the child but since we were 2 adults, there was a extra charge of 23 Euros. Basically they wanted another 23 euros no matter what. After a lot of arguing, we agreed to pay 13 euros more for the extra breakfast. (although breakfast was included in the rate).
reviews.title: A Sad 2 star hotel
